changeset:   1778:ddeec18060f6
user:        Cameron Simpson <cs@zip.com.au>
date:        Mon Feb 18 06:43:23 2002 +0000
files:       cdrip
description:
Optional "-l lock" flag to make encoding completely asynchronous from the
ripper and still run only one encoder at a time. This permits ripping
several discs (because the data come off the disc much faster than
the encoder makes Ogg files) and letting the encoding run overnight or
whatever. You do need sufficient disc space for the raw data backlog
(i.e. ~600Mb per disc). [CVS rev 1.12]

changeset:   2823:4912abc668d9
user:        Cameron Simpson <cs@zip.com.au>
date:        Sun Feb 23 01:35:13 2003 +0000
files:       htforms
description:
Add further hacks to handle busted HTML. The case in point was the everything
open encyclopaedia, which opened a form inside a table element and had form
elements in other table elements. naturally the closure of the first element
closed the form in syntax recovery mode, so this hack adds subsequent form
elements to the recently closed form if no other form is currently open.
There's a related hack added to cs::HTML to aid the parse recovery.
Yucko. Bug report filed to everything. [CVS rev 1.2]

changeset:   3619:cada9c2318a9
user:        Cameron Simpson <cs@zip.com.au>
date:        Sun Mar 07 00:37:12 2004 +0000
files:       cs/Pathname.pm
description:
Add compare function:
  =item compare(file1,file2)
  Compare the contents of two files.
  Returns:
  B<undef> if one of the files can't be opened or if a read fails.
  B<0> if the files are identical.
  B<-1> if the files differ and I<file1> is a prefix of I<file2>.
  B<-2> if the files differ and I<file1>'s differing byte is less than I<file2>'s byte.
  B<1> if the files differ and I<file2> is a prefix of I<file1>.
  B<2> if the files differ and I<file2>'s differing byte is less than I<file1>'s byte. [CVS rev 1.8]

changeset:   4560:bd8bde690650
user:        Cameron Simpson <cs@zip.com.au>
date:        Thu Dec 30 22:43:39 2004 +0000
files:       syncenv
description:
Emit output to re-source the environment files if they've been updated.
Have to do them all if any are new because of ordering.
This is a tool to help tracking global environment
(mostly for $LOCATION for laptops).
Shells and persistent and interested daemons go:
	mypid=$$
	eval "`syncenv $mypid`"
on a regular basis.
Consequently the "global" environment should control very few variables. [CVS rev 1.1]

files:       rigtcpiornc
description:
Dispatch tcpio ssh tunnel according to input data.
Input line format:
	localif localport remotesite remotehost remoteport
which sets up a "tcpio -a" to listing on the interface "localif"
on port "localport", using rnc to forward connections via ssh to "remotesite"
and thence via nc to the host "remotehost", port "remoteport". [CVS rev 1.1]

date:        Sat May 14 03:50:34 2005 +0000
files:       rigtcpiofwds
description:
Dispatch tcpio cleartext TCP forwards according to input data.
Input line format:
	localaddr localport remotehost remoteport
which sets up a "tcpio -a" to listening on the interface "localaddr"
on port "localport", using rnc to forward connections via nc
to the host "remotehost", port "remoteport". [CVS rev 1.1]

changeset:   5955:cfaf5edff72c
user:        Cameron Simpson <cs@zip.com.au>
date:        Fri Oct 13 04:40:34 2006 +0000
files:       cs/dbdigraph.py
description:
Add exactlyOne() convenience method to return element 0 of an array
or throw an IndexError exception. Arguably this should be in cs.misc
or something.
Add testType(obj). Return True if obj.TYPE in type list or obj is a word
in the typelist.
Permit single letter capwords.
Add createDB() function to instantiate tables in empty db.
Add preload() method.
Anonymous nodes now have NAME == None.
Generally discard functions returning nodeids in favour of functions
returning nodes; more db I/O but less latency and more caching.
Add a bunc of nodesBy*() methods.
Nodes now print themselves with nice debug friendly names.
Recast EDGEs to directly connect to their parent and not method their
child - the child connects. MUCH faster and more convenient.
Add AttrTable and AttrSet, presenting the ATTRS table via an nodeid index. [CVS rev 1.4]

 # The default comes from the environment variable B<$MAILDOMAIN>.
 # In fact this may be a list of domains if you have some equvalents,
 # separated by commas.
+#
+# =item B<-S>
+#
+# Synchronous. All continue rules will use a lock file.
+# This constrains procmail(1) from becoming a fork bomb
+# if there are many continue rules,
+# such as may occur in a cross-referencing rule list.
 #
 # =item B<-t> I<type>
 #
@@ -254,26 +261,34 @@ dfltType='UNIX'         # UNIX mbox fold

-
-usage='''Usage: %s [-a alert] [-d dir] [-L] [-m domains] [-t {unix|mh|maildir}] -T <categories >procmailrc
+substitutions={}        # replace {{foo}} in rules
+syncRules=False         # let procmail be fork happy on continue/copy rules
+
+usage='''Usage: %s [-a alert] [-d dir] [-L] [-m domains] [-S] [-t {unix|mh|maildir}] -T <categories >procmailrc
 	-a alert	Command line to generate the alert.
 			The mail item is present on standard input.
         -d dirpath      Look for relative included files in these directories.
+        -D subst=val    Add a macro definition just as $CATS2PROCMAILRC_subst=val does.
 	-L		Use X-Label: header instead of Subject: for tag.
 	-m domains	Select default mail domain(s).
 			Default from $MAILDOMAIN.
+        -S              Synchronous. Use a lock on all continue/copy rules.
 	-t type		Select default mailbox type.
 			Default: %s
 	-T		Don't track rule matches by inserting an
 			X-Cats2Procmailrc-Matching-Rule header.
 ''' % (cmd, dfltType)

+assign_re=re.compile(r'[a-z]\w+=', re.I)
+target_re=re.compile(r'("[^"]*"|[^"\s]+)')
+hdrlist_re=re.compile(r'([a-z][\-a-z0-9]*(,[a-z][\-a-z0-9]*)*):', re.I)
+

 try:
-  opts, argv = getopt(argv, 'a:d:Lm:t:T')
+  opts, argv = getopt(argv, 'a:d:D:Lm:S:t:T')

   cmderr("bad options:", str(e))
   badopts=True
@@ -283,10 +298,19 @@ for opt, arg in opts:
     alertCommand=arg
   elif opt == '-d':
     includePath=arg.split(':')
+  elif opt == '-D':
+    m=assign_re.match(arg)
+    if not m:
+      cmderr("invalid subst=val argument to -D:", arg)
+      badopts=True
+    else:
+      substitutions[arg[:m.end()-1]]=arg[m.end():]
   elif opt == '-L':
     useXLabel=True
   elif opt == '-m':
     dfltDomains=arg.split(',')
+  elif opt == '-S':
+    syncRules=True
   elif opt == '-t':

description:
A "stringish" object that collates a list of strings and presents them as one
to avoid realloc-like pain while accruing a large string. This whole class may
be a mistake, but exists to work around a horrible performance problem in ZSI
when I abuse SOAP with enormous packets. Can probably be replaced with a
special outputwriter for the ZSI binding object.

changeset:   7806:4c1ed651831d
tag:         release-20100719
user:        Cameron Simpson <cs@zip.com.au>
date:        Mon Jul 19 11:15:09 2010 +1000
files:       release/20100719/CHANGES.txt release/20100719/SUMMARY.txt release/20100719/release-tag.txt
description:
Release information for release-20100719.
Summary:
Many changes, bugfixes and some new stuff.
TokyoCabinet backend for NodeDB. Move some more of the less general purpose
stuff to the bin-cs directory and clean out a few dead scripts. Update
the "set -- ..." incantations in a bunch of scripts. Start on NodeDB URLs.
cs.threads.Channel.close() bugfix. Logging changes in a bunch of modules.
cs.threads.TimerQueue: various improvements. Some venti support in NodeDB.
New plaintext/hexcode transcription for venti. Many other updates to venti.
log-hg-commit: log to dlog using category from .hg-cs-category file.
Split perl, python and java code into separate lib subdirs.
New cs.threads.IterablePriorityQueue. Apphelper view-unknown fix.
with-opt-css wrapper script updates. sshto: -P option for tracing error
source hosts. Start on cs.app.maildb somewhat. New AttributableList and
MethodicalList in cs.mappings.

Release information for release-20101011.
Summary:
cs.later.Later: equivalent to proposed futures module, as replacement for
clunky FuncMultiQueue; cs.nodedb: change key pluraity convention, httpd
interface for browsing the db, assorted bugfixes; cs.venti: manage _bg calls
using Later, recode StreamStore completely, add ssh:// store URIs; cs.misc:
obsolete a lot of old debugging stuff in favour of cs.logutils and logging;
cs.excutils: exception handling convenince functions; cs.htreads: WorkerThreadPool for handling parallel requests; scripts: many moinor changes following
from cs.misc debug code obsoletion

description:
Release information for release-20101019.
Summary:
Scripts:
  addif,delif: FreeBSD support; bmtail: batch multitail from file of
  logfiles; haproxy-get-listen-ips: grab listen IPs and clauses names from
  haproxy config file; cats2procmailrc: add -C (continue mode) option.
Modules:
  Incorporate cs.upd output mode into default logging in setup_logging(), and
  several bugfixes and improvements to cs.logutils and cs.upd; support
  passing Pfx context to deferred execution via cs.later.Later or
  cs.threads.WorkerThreadPool; several minor fixes and improvements.

changeset:   8476:e6a44a3de0c8
tag:         release-20111022
user:        Cameron Simpson <cs@zip.com.au>
date:        Sat Oct 22 14:44:41 2011 +1100
files:       release/20111022/CHANGES.txt release/20111022/SUMMARY.txt release/20111022/release-tag.txt
description:
Release information for release-20111022.
Summary:
New scripts:
cache-transform - cache results of data transformation,
hgbox - dropbox-ish syncing based on mercurial,
ifstat, ifstat-diff - report network interface stats and their changes,
inscr - dispatch a command in a new screen session,
merge-dumb - trivial merge command for accruing files (like timesheets),
nagios_check_snmp_extend - yet another SNMP checker,
nodedb - convenience command line wrapper for cs.nodedb,
ping-monitor - watch connectivity to a host and act on changes,
py25+, py26+, py27+ - find and exec a sufficiently recent python,
rpm-comparehost - compare the RPM packages of this host with others and
optionally update to match,
sux - run command via su with correct argument quoting,
with-vm-img-partition - mount partition from disc image and run command.

Many script updates, notably:
OK, mail-on-error, execif - improve these reporting commands,
cpmysql - mysql bug workaround,
patch-config - add -O and -o modes to do its own file rewriting,
sshto - workaround for rsync excess user@host parsing.

Many library updates, notably:
cs.curlytplt - templating library for {foo} and {{foo}} macros,
cs.fileutils - compare() and rewrite() functions,
cs.later - add .ready() method to provide context manager mode,
cs.mailutils - high speed Maildir class,
cs.nodedb - wide CSV format for human editors, make Backends look like maps,
add metanodes for db and type info and state, support for "unnamed" nodes with
sequential ids, many parsing improvements and fixes,
cs.threads - bugfix Channel put/get methods.
